  if(!App.defaults.user_json.person.expert && location.hash !== '' ){
    if(/\#apps\/(.+)/.test(location.href)){
      location = '/'+location.hash.substr(1).match(/apps\/[0-9]+/)
    }else if(/\/#ask_a_question\/(.+)/.test(location.href)){
      location = location.href.replace('#ask_a_question', 'search');
    }else if(/\/#ask_a_question/.test(location.href)){
      location = location.href.replace('#ask_a_question', 'login');
    }else if((/\?Prime=true/.test(location.href)) && (/#expert_sign_up/.test(location.href))){
      location = location.href.replace("/?Prime=true", "/expert_sign_up?Prime=true")     
    }else{
      location = location.href.replace('.com/#', '.com/');
    }
  }
  
  
  
  if(App.defaults.user_json.person.guest){
    (function(){
    
      var h = location.hash;
      
      if(h.match(/^#(expert\/(settings|enhance_profile)|promote|patientDirectory|docscore)/)){
        
        document.cookie = 'redirect_to='+encodeURIComponent('/'+h)+'; path=/';
        location.href = '/login';
        
      }
    
    
    })();
  }
</script>

<a class='question' href='/user_questions/252674'>
Is it bad when a 2year old bleeds of an on from the nose?
</a>
<span class='in-brief'>In brief:</span>
<span class='short-answer'>
It depends
</span>
<div class='long-answer'>
If your child has other bleeding-ex: bleeds from gums when brush teeth, has prolonged bleeding from cuts, or bruises easily, have your child evaluated by a doctor.  If the bleeding is always from the same nostril then also should be checked.
</div>
<a class='answer-img' href='/user_questions/252674' style='background-image: url("https://edc2.healthtap.com/ht-staging/user_answer/avatars/359536/large/open-uri20120816-27001-1eunvxr.jpeg?1386556226")'></a>
<div class='long-answer'>
<!-- truncate this text -->
<div class='dotdotdot' style='height:60px;overflow:hidden;'>
<span class='answer-text'>
  If not and no signs allergies (which can cause bloody nose), use vaseline to outer nares one to two times/day, and humidify the air when sleeping.
</span>

<a class='question' href='/user_questions/251599'>
How can I encourage my child to eat a variety of healthy foods?
</a>
<span class='in-brief'>In brief:</span>
<span class='short-answer'>
Keep tyring!
</span>
<div class='long-answer'>
All you can do is make the foods available and model good eating habits.
</div>
<a class='answer-img' href='/user_questions/251599' style='background-image: url("https://edc2.healthtap.com/ht-staging/user_answer/avatars/359533/large/open-uri20120816-27078-1rltqa5.jpeg?1386596366")'></a>
<div class='long-answer'>
<!-- truncate this text -->
<div class='dotdotdot' style='height:60px;overflow:hidden;'>
<span class='answer-text'>
  Different textures, colors, etc. Make food more appealing.  Also, allow your child to experience the food in different ways - ex: raw, cooked, frozen even.  Pairing unfamilar foods with foods they already like can help.  Also, dips are a great way for kids to try new foods.
</span>

<a class='question' href='/user_questions/237468'>
What type of doctor treats autism?
</a>
<span class='in-brief'>In brief:</span>
<span class='short-answer'>
Mainly 2 different
</span>
<div class='long-answer'>
Usually neurologists and/or behavioral pediatricians diagnose and/or treat autism.  However, many places now have autism clinics that are "multi-disciplinary" including a host of medical providers such as speech therapists, ot's, nurse practitioners and physicians.
</div>
<div class='long-answer'>
<!-- truncate this text -->
<span class='answer-text'>   </span>

<a class='question' href='/user_questions/236577'>
Does the MMR vaccine have anything to do with autism?
</a>
<span class='in-brief'>In brief:</span>
<span class='short-answer'>
NO!
</span>
<div class='long-answer'>
Absolutely not.  The original study linking the MMR vaccine to autism was flawed and has been discounted and the lead author has had his medical license taken away!  there have been multiple studies looking for an association between the vaccine and autism and none has been found.
</div>
<div class='long-answer'>
<!-- truncate this text -->
<span class='answer-text'>  It is especially important to get since we are seeing outbreaks of measles.   </span>

<a class='question' href='/user_questions/236859'>
If I had an adverse reaction to my 1st HPV vaccine should I have the second?
</a>
<span class='in-brief'>In brief:</span>
<span class='short-answer'>
Probably
</span>
<div class='long-answer'>
An adverse reaction such as passing out, sore arm, headache, etc.
</div>
<a class='answer-img' href='/user_questions/236859' style='background-image: url("https://edc2.healthtap.com/ht-staging/user_answer/reference_image/1889/large/breathing.jpeg?1386670184")'></a>
<div class='long-answer'>
<!-- truncate this text -->
<div class='dotdotdot' style='height:60px;overflow:hidden;'>
<span class='answer-text'>
 Are not considered contraindications to receiving further doses.  Allergic reactions such as difficulty breathing, wheezing, swelling of lips/tongue are reasons to have no further doses.
</span>
<a class='see-more-link' href='/user_questions/236859'>
...See more
</a>

<a class='question' href='/user_questions/237745'>
How long after i've had the HPV vaccination should I wait to drink alcohol?
</a>
<span class='in-brief'>In brief:</span>
<span class='short-answer'>
No time limit
</span>
<div class='long-answer'>
You must have gotten the hpv vaccine "off label" since the vaccine is only approved from ages 9-26 but as far as i know, there is no reason you can't drink alcohol after receiving the shot.
</div>
<a class='answer-img' href='/user_questions/237745' style='background-image: url("https://edc2.healthtap.com/ht-staging/user_answer/reference_image/1900/large/hpv.jpeg?1386668955")'></a>
<div class='long-answer'>
<!-- truncate this text -->
<span class='answer-text'>  Drink in moderation please!   </span>
